triples.name: Mpemba effect
triples.relevance: The paper studies a quantum version of the classical Mpemba effect, where hot water can freeze faster than warm water.

triples.name: Integrable system
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes the quantum Mpemba effect specifically in closed many-body integrable systems with U(1) conserved charges.

triples.name: Entropy of entanglement
triples.relevance: The paper uses entanglement asymmetry, a recently introduced measure related to entanglement entropy, to establish criteria for the quantum Mpemba effect.

triples.name: Cellular automaton
triples.relevance: The Rule 54 cellular automaton is used as a specific example system to demonstrate and test the quantum Mpemba effect criteria.

triples.name: Fermion
triples.relevance: Free fermion models are explicitly used as an example system to analyze the quantum Mpemba effect.

triples.name: Lieb-Liniger model
triples.relevance: The Lieb-Liniger model (a 1D Bose gas with delta interactions) serves as another key example system for demonstrating the quantum Mpemba effect.

triples.name: Quantum Mpemba effect
triples.relevance: The paper establishes the microscopic origins and criteria for the quantum Mpemba effect in integrable systems, introducing a novel understanding of how asymmetric initial configurations can relax faster than symmetric ones.
